item.description:
Report X-2023101130

  • City: BOWLING GREEN

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was Sent through overhead conveyors. Splitter discovered wet package and reported to manager to alert trained personnel to contain spill, before conveyer restarted DescribePack: Package was found wet DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated, spill was cleaned with PPE and taken to hazmat area for inspection.

item.title: Report E-2023100546
item.description:
Report E-2023100546

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 9, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1993 was crushed during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of UN1993 for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Once collected, TLE personnel utilized a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. The undamaged freight was re-secured for normal transport. All UN1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: 5:04 AM AEROSOL PROTECTIVE COVER CAPS CAME LOOSE ALLOWING NOZZEL TO RELEASE SPILLAGE DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: CAN EMPTY

item.title: Report E-2023100565
item.description:
Report E-2023100565

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: MARION
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver inadvertently attempted to disconnect the delivery hose from the customer's storage tank while gasoline was still flowing. This caused less than 5 gallons of gasoline to be released. The driver was able to remediate the spill without incident.

item.title: Report E-2023100526
item.description:
Report E-2023100526

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 2 of the metal 5 gallon pails of brush cement (un1133) had been damaged by other freight and had released 2 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023100520
item.description:
Report E-2023100520

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio Express
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tote was discovered leaking with a small crack in one of the top corners. It appears that the damage to the tote was caused by a manufacturer defect in the tote bin. The released material was neutralized and cleaned up with absorbent material. The packaging specifications were not able to be obtained from the tote.

DescribePack: Package has a cap that it most likely was dropped on which then leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a salvage drum to mitigate the effects of the release.
